there are a couple of stories that I've
heard about other valet companies here
locally in Atlanta one happened at the
local mall where a gentleman pulled in
and a BMW 7-series is brand new at the
time and they valet gave him a ticket
the person went inside I'm not sure if
the criminal was watching but what the
criminal did was run after the customer
through the mall I don't know how that
customer was dressed and said excuse me
sir you we gave you the wrong ticket
that's not your ticket this is your
ticket so he must have given him a dead
ticket or a false ticket or some type of
ticket but now he has the criminal has
the real ticket so the criminal went
outside maybe five or ten minutes later
change his outfit
whatever the case was handed it to the
valet valet bought up a brand new car
the government criminal got in a car and
drove away
the customer comes outside probably
about hour later said here's my ticket
and it took him a long time to figure
out they had to look at the video
cameras to show that the car had left
earlier but it was a customer's fault
entirely forgiven his ticket up to a
person that wasn't a true uniform to
valet
now this criminal was found three days
later at a DUI checkpoint still driving
the car and he got arrested and the
customer got their car back the second
story I heard and this is another
company here in Atlanta this was a paid
parking lot so the valets had or the
customers had to pay to park the cars I
always tell my valets please be careful
do not pull out a wad of cash just have
a pocket for change another pocket for
the primary dollars then after a while
do a money drop so you don't have a
large amount of money on it this one
particular valet I heard from the
building manager once they brought us in
to interview had over 400 or 500 dollars
on him so when the person asked for
change he pulls out a wad of money and
when they saw that they grabbed the
valet so the valet they essentially
stole the valet so the valet was in the
car they wrestled the money the car I
think it was a suburban or Tahoe or
something left out of the circular
roundabout onto the street down the
block made a right going towards the
freeway and by that time they had
wrestled the money out and through the
battle
out the car but for at least 60 seconds
they had stolen the valet so the reason
why I found out this information this
particular building called us in for an
interview they wanted to interview new
valet companies to replace this company
this unfortunately wasn't the first
problem this company had but they were
interviewing new companies to come
onboard but honestly what stories like
that that concerns me as an owner
because I don't want to put my guys in a
situation like that it's gotten to a
point where our company where we've
actually gone down in size on purpose
and tried to keep just are profitable
accounts we were concerned about before
having the most accounts and all this
but as you can see with these stories
that creates more problems and even
though I love sharing these stories I
like my sleep at night too so a lot of
times I try to control this and say you
know what I'm just gonna keep my top 10
or 20 accounts and then everybody else
can have the rest and this is a story
it's not our company but we like to work
together so we know what's going on so a
lot of the valet companies will actually
come together maybe once a year and kind
of talk over their problems and so we
can kind of learn and kind of prevent
things from happening to us in the
future so this one case actually became
an international story
of course the valet left the Box
unattended which I don't lock we're
constantly telling these valleys make
sure these boxes are locked each and
every time this was earlier on a brunch
on a Sunday where they did not lock the
box and someone came in and stole two
keys and Audi and a Mercedes
they stole both the cars the Mercedes
was a particular one because this guy's
father had passed away one week earlier
an auto accident and his ashes were in
the car so that's we can't believe that
you can't even how do you deal with that
of course we can replace the car but we
can't replace your father so it was all
over the media trying to just get the
ashes back they didn't even care about
the car because they wanted to spread
the ashes out the very next day with his
family
I believe the insurance company paid for
the car and then they had to pay
compensatory damages for the loss of his
father which was never retrieved this
one place it was a restaurant no valet
was driving an Audi a4 and the customer
came in again not our company pulled in
the valet put the brake up another
gets into the car puts the brake down
puts the car in neutral starts the car
but the keys not in it but the car is

down and it ends up hitting the wall of

for the entire building because that's

wall the Audi airbags blew the valet
gets off the car he has powder all over
him and even though the car was totaled
I think it hit almost 20 miles per hour
coming down this long sloping hill the
compensatory damages for the loss of use
for business for that day and I think

thousands of dollars of course inside
